SUMMARY:  INNER | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL:  FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

org.tigris.noodle
Class NoodleData

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--org.tigris.noodle.NoodleData
public class NoodleData
extends java.lang.Object

NoodleData is a per-request container containing the stage of one proxied request, and the logic to stream that request to the client.

Author:
Jon S. Stevens, Leonard Richardson

Field Summary
private  java.util.SortedMap activeFilters
          A SortedMap mapping ordinals to currently active proxy response filters.
protected  java.lang.String charset
          The encoding of the data which we're preparing to write (if we read in unicode bytes and are preparing to output, this is the encoding for the output).

charset

protected java.lang.String charset
The encoding of the data which we're preparing to write (if we read in unicode bytes and are preparing to output, this is the encoding for the output). This will be null if the data is being read as bytes.

useCharacterReader

protected java.lang.Boolean useCharacterReader
This is just cached locally to store the result of logic which may be more complex.

getProxyResponse

public HTTPClient.HTTPResponse getProxyResponse()
Returns the HTTP response from the proxy. Will return null if there is not yet a connection to the proxy.

setProxyResponse

void setProxyResponse(HTTPClient.HTTPResponse proxyResponse)
The HTTP response from the proxy. You should never need to call this directly--it's called from ProxyModule.

getURL

public java.net.URL getURL()
Returns the URL used to connect to the proxy.

setURL

public void setURL(java.net.URL url)
Sets the URL used to connect to the proxy. Should only be called by request filters.

getHeadersToSend

public java.util.List getHeadersToSend()
Returns the List of name-value pairs corresponding to the headers to send.

setHeadersToSend

public void setHeadersToSend(java.util.Vector headersToSend)
Sets the Vector of name-value pairs corresponding to the headers to send. Should only be called by request filters.

getHeadersToSendAsNVPair

HTTPClient.NVPair[] getHeadersToSendAsNVPair()
You shouldn't need to execute this method directly; it's called by ProxyModule.

getHeadersToSendAsString

public java.lang.String getHeadersToSendAsString()
Returns the headers to send as a string.

getPostData

public byte[] getPostData()
Returns the POST data from the client request, if any.

setPostData

public void setPostData(byte[] postData)
Sets the POST data from the client request. If there is no POST data, this should be called with null. Should only be called by request filters.

getQueryData

public java.lang.String getQueryData()
Returns the query data from the client request, if it exists.

setQueryData

public void setQueryData(java.lang.String queryData)
Sets the query data from the client request. If there is no query data, this should be called with null. Should only be called by request filters.

getValue

public java.lang.Object getValue(java.lang.String key)
Retrieves a value from the general storage area.

putValue

public void putValue(java.lang.String key,
                     java.lang.Object value)
Adds a value to the general storage area.

getActiveFilters

public java.util.Iterator getActiveFilters()
Returns an iterator over the currently active proxy response filters. We put them in another Map and return an iterator to the other map, so that we can remove items from the original map without getting a CME. This should probably be rewritten so that it doesn't need to use duplicate storage.

getFinalizerFilters

public java.util.Iterator getFinalizerFilters()
Returns an iterator over the current finalizer filters. We put them in another Map and return an iterator to the other map, so that we can remove items from the original map without getting a CME. This should probably be rewritten so that it doesn't need to use duplicate storage.

killFilter

public boolean killFilter(NoodleResponseFilter filter)
Kills an active filter.
Returns:
Whether or not there are any active filters left.

killFilters

public boolean killFilters()
Kills all active and finalizer filters.
Returns:
Whether or not there are any active filters (there won't be).

runProxyResponseFilter

protected int runProxyResponseFilter(NoodleResponseFilter filter,
                                     ResponseBlock block)
                              throws java.lang.Exception
Sets the given proxy response filter loose on the current block and does an integrity check on the results.

getDefaultCharset

public java.lang.String getDefaultCharset()
The default charset to assume if a character stream is used, for reading data from the proxied response.

getOutputCharset

public java.lang.String getOutputCharset()
The charset to assume if a character stream is used, for sending data back to the original client.

proxyRequest

public void proxyRequest()
                  throws java.lang.Exception
Assuming this NoodleData instance has been set up properly, this method will run a proxy request through the request filters, get the response, and stream the response through the defined response filters.

getReader

protected NoodleReader getReader()
                          throws NoodleException
Get the noodle reader, which is responsible for getting blocks of data from the response. Since we break the response up into blocks, it is important to respect character boundaries when we want to process byte data as Strings; however, the default reader assumes the default encoding, since that's also safe for binary data.

useCharacterReader

public boolean useCharacterReader()
                           throws NoodleException
This determines if we should try to interact with the incoming data as characters or as bytes.

proxyRequest

public void proxyRequest(java.lang.String inSavedOffQuery)
                  throws java.lang.Exception
Assuming this NoodleData instance has been set up properly, this method will run a proxy request through the request filters, get the response, and stream the response through the defined response filters.

streamBlock

public void streamBlock(ResponseBlock block)
                 throws java.io.IOException,
                        NoodleException
Streams the current block from the current pointer to the end of the block.

streamBlockTo

public void streamBlockTo(ResponseBlock block,
                          int lastStreamedByte)
                   throws java.io.IOException,
                          NoodleException
Streams the current block from the current pointer to the given offset, inclusively.

postProcessPageName

public java.lang.String postProcessPageName(java.lang.String page)
Override this method if you want a hook for ProxyRequest to call which will allow you to change the URL Noodle is proxying just before ProxyRequest makes the HTTP call.
